buri.ddmsence.ddms.summary

Class RelatedResource

  • Object
    • buri.ddmsence.AbstractBaseComponent
      • buri.ddmsence.AbstractQualifierValue
        • buri.ddmsence.ddms.summary.RelatedResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDDMSComponent

    public final class RelatedResource
extends AbstractQualifierValue
    An immutable implementation of the ddms:relatedResource component.

    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0

    History

    Before DDMS 4.0.1, ddms:RelatedResources was the top-level component (0-many in a resource) and contained 1 to many ddms:relatedResource components. Starting in DDMS 4.0.1, the ddms:RelatedResources component was removed, and the ddms:relatedResource now contains all of the parent information (relationship and direction).

    The element-based constructor for this class can automatically handle these cases, and will automatically mediate the Text/HTML/JSON/XML output:

    • A pre-DDMS 4.0.1 ddms:RelatedResources element containing 1 ddms:relatedResource.
    • A post-DDMS 4.0.1 ddms:relatedResource element.

    If you have a case where a pre-DDMS 4.0.1 ddms:RelatedResources element contained 5 ddms:relatedResource elements, the Resource class will automatically mediate it to create 5 RelatedResource instances. If an old-fashioned parent element containing multiple children is loaded in the element-based constructor, only the first child will be processed, and a warning will be provided.

    Nested Elements
    NameCardinalityAvailability
    ddms:link1..*
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    Attributes
    NameCardinalityAvailability
    ddms:relationship1
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    ddms:direction0..1
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    ddms:qualifier1
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    ddms:value1
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    ism:<securityAttributes>0..*
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    Validation Rules
    RuleTypeApplicability
    The qualified name of this element must be correct.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    ddms:relationship must exist, and must be a valid URI.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    If set, ddms:direction must be a valid token.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    ddms:qualifier must exist, and must be a valid URI.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    ddms:value must exist.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    At least 1 ddms:link exists.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    Links must not contain security attributes.Error
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0
    Parent component should not contain more than 1 ddms:relatedResource.Warning
    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0

    Does NOT validate that the value is valid against the qualifier's vocabulary.

    Since:
    0.9.b
    Author:
    Brian Uri!

        Renders this component as a JSON object, which can either be converted to a JSON string or inserted into the parent JSON object. Although this method is marked a public, it is only intended to be used internally, and is not part of the IDDMSComponent interface. Use the toJSON() method as the public way to get JSON output.

      • getHTMLTextOutput

        public String getHTMLTextOutput(OutputFormat format,
                                String prefix,
                                String suffix)
        Description copied from class: AbstractBaseComponent
        Renders this component as HTML or Text, with an optional prefix to nest it.

        I consider this to be an internal method, that unfortunately must be marked as public to allow cross-package access when generating output. Use toHTML() and toText() as the formal, public methods to generate output.

        Specified by:
        getHTMLTextOutput in class AbstractBaseComponent
        Parameters:
        format - the desired format of this output
        prefix - an optional prefix to put on each name.
        suffix - an optional suffix to append to each name, such as an index.
        Returns:
        the representation of this component in the specified format
        See Also:
        AbstractBaseComponent.getHTMLTextOutput(OutputFormat, String, String)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Description copied from class: AbstractBaseComponent
        Test for logical equality.

        The base case tests against the name value and namespaceURI, as well as any child components classified as "nested components" and any security attributes. Extending classes may require additional rules for equality. This case automatically includes any nested components or security attributes.

        Overrides:
        equals in class AbstractQualifierValue
        See Also:
        Object.equals(Object)
